item.title: Singaporeans have the ability to hail a cab using Hailo
item.description: Hailo, a highly-rated taxi app boasting more five-star reviews than any other similar service, launched in Singapore on October 29th. With a global network of over 60,000 drivers and a strong user base exceeding 1.4 million, Hailo reports a ride request every two seconds somewhere in the world. Source: Hailo. From left: Benny Lim, Managing Director, SMRT Road Holdings; Ron Zeghibe, Co-Founder & Executive Chairman, Hailo Global, and Yu Hsiang Wong, General Manager, Hailo Singapore.

item.title: TaxiPixi cab booking app is now available in Kuala Lumpur and will soon be expanding to more countries
item.description: TaxiPixi, a cab booking app, has expanded its reach to Malaysia and will be pre-installed on Celkon phones in India, Sri Lanka, South Africa, and Nepal. Developed by India-based On Time Technologies, TaxiPixi launched in Malaysia this week. Celkon, a mobile phone manufacturer, will pre-install the app on its devices in several countries. Pradeep Yerraguntla, Celkon’s Head of Digital, stated that Celkon will promote the app through its app store and website, targeting consumers in India, Sri Lanka, South Africa, and Nepal.

item.title: GrabTaxi introduces GrabCar service in Phuket
item.description: Source: GrabTaxi. GrabTaxi, a mobile application for on-demand transportation in Southeast Asia, has introduced a new service in Phuket, Thailand, called GrabCar. This premium service aims to simplify transportation for Phuket visitors by offering a personalized riding experience. Tourists can use the app to book a GrabCar and be picked up directly from their location within minutes, allowing them to conveniently and securely explore Phuket with just a few taps on their phones.

item.title: Makani numbers in Dubai assist taxi drivers in locating their customers
item.description: Source: RTA. Dubai taxis are now connected to the city through the Makani system. Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) Public Transport Agency has successfully connected 4,500 taxis operated by franchise companies to the Dubai Municipality’s Makani System. This system utilizes unique coordinates, known as Makani numbers, for precise building location. Adel Shakri, Director of Transportation Systems at RTA’s Public Transport Agency, highlighted the significant role of the Makani System.

item.title: The partnership between SMRT JV and Hailo Singapore will enable the use of electronic receipts for taxi rides
item.description: SMRT Road Holdings (SMRT Roads) and London-based taxi app developer Hailo Network Holdings (Hailo) have partnered to launch Hailo Singapore. This joint venture will introduce a new taxi booking application in Singapore. Benny Lim, Managing Director of SMRT Roads, believes this collaboration will improve the passenger experience. He stated that combining Hailo’s technology with SMRT’s operational knowledge will create a seamless booking process for both passengers and drivers. Ron Zeghibe, Executive Chairman and Co-Founder of Hailo Network, emphasized Hailo’s goal of optimizing taxi services globally.

item.title: The TaxiPixi app has been awarded the mBillionth Award in South Asia for its taxi booking services
item.description: TaxiPixi, a mobile application for booking taxis, has won the award for best Travel App in South Asia at the 5th annual mBillionth Awards. The app works by connecting customers to taxi drivers from different companies in real time. The mBillionth Awards recognize exceptional mobile applications and digital material from eight South Asian countries: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, the Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka. Source: TaxiPixi. “This award boosts our confidence and reaffirms our commitment to providing a comprehensive solution for urban transportation,” said TaxiPixi CEO Kajal Dubey.

item.title: Passenger figures for Dubai taxis in the first quarter of 2017 have been released
item.description: Source: RTA. A taxi on Dubai roads. During the first quarter of 2017, taxis in Dubai, UAE provided 25,795,251 rides, serving a total of 44,883,737 passengers. Dubai’s taxi franchises collectively operate 10,038 vehicles. Here’s a breakdown by company: Dubai Taxi: 12,981,104 trips, serving 21,050,701 passengers. Arabia Taxi: 2,536,705 trips, serving 4,413,867 passengers. Cars Taxi: 5,311,065 trips, serving 9,241,253 passengers. Metro Taxi: 1,995,090 trips, serving 3,471,457 passengers. National Taxi: 3,755,367 trips, serving 6,534,339 passengers.
